data.title: Okay - but better Mexican available in Oxnard!
data.text: I recently met a friend for dinner at Sabor - a first time for both of us. This restaurant is downtown Oxnard on 6th just off Oxnard Blvd. It has parking outside and on the street. The building is very recognizable with a huge whale painted on the exterior. Inside it feels very colorful and I loved the mural on the ceiling with clouds and all sorts of flying birds. It was a very hot evening and uncomfortable inside the restaurant. They had ceiling fans and a floor fan going, but it was not enough to move the air. It was hot and humid and distracted from the meal. We were the only customers in the restaurant. As we came in - one couple was leaving, but there were no others eating. As we were close to finishing, a group of 4 entered. We were not aware that there was no waitress/waiter service and that you had to place your order at the counter. The man behind the counter was very nice - but you don't really get time, or a good description of all that is available. I ordered a combo platter of carnitas - with beans and rice. The serving was on the small side - unusual for Mexican, especially with the rice and the beans. The carnitas was very dry and had no sauce. I used salsa from the self serve salsa bar and this made the meal much better. Most carnitas that I have had elsewhere have been very juicy and tender, but not this one. It had a nice flavor but was just too dry. My friend ordered the shrimp fajitas and it was not what one would expect. It was just a side of shrimp with onions on a plate with some sides and crispy tortillas. It was not served in a hot dish as has always been my experience, but on a normal plate and was again on the dry side. The shrimp was over cooked. We each had a margarita with our meal, which were good - on the tart side, just how I like them. They did not have much alcohol in them, but were very tasty. So, we each had a drink and a main dish, and our bill was $40. Seems high for this type of food in this type of a setting. While nothing was bad, except the heat - I probably won't be back as there is much better Mexican food to be had in Oxnard - at the same, or better pricing.

data.title: Downtown Mazatlan!
data.text: Really, for those looking for a Mexican Beach experience (without the surf close by) this does it-Diego Rivera type of furniture, bright, super staff-oh, yeah, the food; it's really very good. The fish tacos are as good as the other reviewers say, the salsa bar as well. With the bar, try the sauted sweet onions and the roasted pepper-both will knock yo down with the taste.For a town full of good Mexican places, this one merits a do-over.

data.title: Quick fast bite
data.text: Needed a small food en route to LA and this hit the spot.  Very good carnitas and grilled Mahi Mahi tacos plus a bonus chip and salsa bar.  4 tacos and two drinks was less than $13.  Recommended!

data.title: Surprisingly Very Good and Very Friendly
data.text:
Coming off the boat in Channel Islands Harbor from a weekend on the Channel Islands, my wife and I wanted to take advantage of being closer to Oxnard than when we normally use the Ventura Harbor.

We checked out some reviews on Mexican food and Sabor was on the top of the list.  However, when we entered, it was subdued lighting, just one other family, and I was a bit concerned that we may have gotten fooled by the reviews.

Well, 30 minutes late after we enjoyed fresh corn tortillas, great chile rellanos, fresh salsa, server-yourself chips, free horchata refill, and a view of the third quarter of SuperBowl 50, we may have found our next favorite place.

The funny thing is, we HAVE to go back.  They are known for their fish tacos and we forgot about that and ordered our go-to chile rellanos.

data.title: Glorious difference
data.text: White table cloth and sparkling stemware is not what you'll find here. But if you like authentic Mexican food and a convivial atmosphere you found the right place.

data.title: Best Fish Tacos
data.text: If you're looking for the best fish tacos in downtown Oxnard, this is the right place to go. Service is good. Food is good. Price is good. So nothing should really go wrong.

data.title: If you Must
data.text: You order at the counter from a menu on the wall. The day we went, someone was having a gathering and the staff could not keep up with the orders. Some of the staff has limited English. The food was okay, but not great.

data.title: if you order well, you can have a great meal
data.text: Fish tacos are the most popular thing on the menu, and are definitely the way to go.  Other items, such as the enchiladas, are not as good.  They have a tortilla chip and salsa bar, which is nice, but none of the options will blow you away. The ambiance is fine, nothing special, but the service is nice enough.

data.title: Great local genuine mexican cuisine.
data.text: Very local traditional mexican cusine.  Try the fish tacos.  Great non pretentious atmosphere.  Not a taco bell or Chi Chis.

data.title: Tasty Fish Tacos along with a Fresh Tortilla and Salsa Bar
data.text: My daughter and her guy friend stopped at Sabor last summer doing their vagabond thing around California after college before career work started. Rosa told me it was the best fish taco she and Will had on their entire trip.  This summer traipsing around California with my younger daughter searching for college options we stopped at Sabor last Tuesday en-route to UCSB up the coast a bit from Oxnard.  This place sits a bit off the main streets but is quite inviting with its whale mural on the exterior wall with its big lettered name. Inside the space is cool, inviting and offers a fresh chip and salsa bar while you wait for your order to be served.  The menu offers Gorditas, Burritos, Tacos and other items.  I had to test the proverbial fish taco waters to enjoy for myself a "so-called best Fish Taco" claim put forward by Rosa.  Well, that girl not only got her mother's beauty, wit and charm but also her exemplary taste buds, too. The 2 fish taco plates we were served, had re-fried pinto beans and rice, and came with four corn tortillas each. Smart service idea that, since this allowed both Lily and I to have four nice full, golden fried fish tacos with lettuce.  The sauce served with the tacos was delicious.  The meal was outstanding, the cost of $18.11 quite fair as it included a "Pacifico" beer in a 12 oz bottle and a large Sierra Mist (16 oz).  Our proffer of a tip to the counter gal was politely refused, with a smile and a soft "no thank you".  Delightful, tasty and very memorable.  It is an extraordinarily good fish taco.  In fact, it is the best I had when traveling on the west coast this past week.

data.title: Best Fish Tacos
data.text:
I love this place.  I have business to take care of in Oxnard most weekends & I try to make a trip to Sabor whenever I go.  I like the guacomole, the chips, the tacos....not just the fish ones, but the chicken, cane asada, and the lengue is good too!

A little bit of a dive but, really good food.  Never had a bad meal there.

data.title: A Hidden Gem in Oxnard, CA
data.text: As noted in the other review, this place is in a sketchy neighborhood, but I have never had a problem going there for lunch. I would also add that it is a favorite of police officers, so if you see a cop car, he is probably inside plowing into a plate of food! Also as noted, the owner has won numerous prizes at Oxnard's Salsa Festival. They have lots of different plates to offer here, centered around seafood, but everyone goes for the fish tacos; they are excellent! Two thin tortillas, deep-fried fish, covered in shredded cabbage and a creamy sauce guaranteed to carry you back to the west coast of Mexico! There is a self-service chip and salsa bar and cold drinks and beers are available from the cooler. Nicely decorated with the most amazing ceiling painting you have ever seen outside of the Sistine Chapel! Buen provecho!

data.title: Sabor = Flavor!!!
data.text: This gem is hidden on 6th St downtown east of Oxnard Blvd. Not the best location to show off the great food that they have. They have trophies on display from competitions like in the local Salsa Festival that Oxnard has once a year. Like Fish tacos? This is the place to go. We have never had a bad meal and been there about 30 times in 5 years. Check out the chalkboard at the entrance for specials. I love the enchiladas and my wife the sopas, everything we have chosen is like "chef" prepared at "cook" prices. Nice decor and good service, off street parking.
